segment.source: Exercise 2 - Manually Collect ETW Logs for Media Scenarios Using WPR
segment.target: Exercise 2 - Manually Collect ETW Logs for Media Scenarios Using WPR

segment.source: Automated tests are great for verifying the audio or temporal video quality of a device for a specific automated scenario; however, if an audio or video glitch occurs during a manual test, then the Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) tool can be used to manually collect an Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) trace during a repro of the problem.
segment.target: Automated tests are great for verifying the audio or temporal video quality of a device for a specific automated scenario; however, if an audio or video glitch occurs during a manual test, then the Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) tool can be used to manually collect an Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) trace during a repro of the problem.

segment.source: Exercise 2 - Manually Collect ETW Logs for Media Scenarios Using WPR
segment.target: Exercise 2 - Manually Collect ETW Logs for Media Scenarios Using WPR

segment.source: Automated tests are great for verifying the audio or temporal video quality of a device for a specific automated scenario; however, if an audio or video glitch occurs during a manual test, then the Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) tool can be used to manually collect an Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) trace during a repro of the problem.
segment.target: Automated tests are great for verifying the audio or temporal video quality of a device for a specific automated scenario; however, if an audio or video glitch occurs during a manual test, then the Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) tool can be used to manually collect an Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) trace during a repro of the problem.

segment.source: Step 1: Collect an ETW trace using WPR
segment.target: Step 1: Collect an ETW trace using WPR

segment.source: Right-click on the Start menu and click on Command Prompt (Admin).
segment.target: Right-click on the Start menu and click on Command Prompt (Admin).

segment.source: Navigate to the folder where you have WPR installed.
segment.target: Navigate to the folder where you have WPR installed.

segment.source: Run a workload such as video playback or a real time communications scenario.
segment.target: Run a workload such as video playback or a real time communications scenario.

segment.source: Step 2: Visualize the ETW trace in MXA
segment.target: Step 2: Visualize the ETW trace in MXA

segment.source: Install the Media eXperience Analyzer (MXA) which can be downloaded here.
segment.target: Install the Media eXperience Analyzer (MXA) which can be downloaded here.

segment.source: Right-click on the Start menu and click on Command Prompt (Admin).
segment.target: Right-click on the Start menu and click on Command Prompt (Admin).

segment.source: Navigate to the folder where you installed MXA.
segment.target: Navigate to the folder where you installed MXA.

segment.source: For example, if Media.etl were located at C:PerformanceMedia, you would type the following command:
segment.target: For example, if Media.etl were located at C:PerformanceMedia, you would type the following command:

segment.source: Press the Turn Symbols Off button to turn off symbol lookup.
segment.target: Press the Turn Symbols Off button to turn off symbol lookup.

segment.source: Explore the various media related datasets and providers enabled in the trace.
segment.target: Explore the various media related datasets and providers enabled in the trace.
